lines.value: the outback is the areas of australia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the outback is not a defined area it is only a term used to refer to locations that are far away from big cities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fertile parts are known as rangelands and have been traditionally used for sheep or cattle farming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: agriculture tourism and mining are the main economic activities in this vast and sparsely settled area
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of the expanses and remoteness in the outback a unique service the flying doctor was created in 1928
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the aim of the service is to provide medical care to people who cannot reach hospitals or other doctors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: consultations are carried out via radio or telephone and for serious situations doctors are flown out to the patients
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: organised travels with a guide to the outback is popular although some australian and international tourists travel in their own cars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: such a trip especially off the few big roads in the outback requires very good planning and a suitable vehicle usually four wheel drive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on remote routes considerable supplies and equipment are required
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some big trips cannot be undertaken safely without a convoy of several vehicles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: deaths of tourists are a regular occurrences because many people are not well prepared for their outback trip

lines.value: coyote canis latrans is an animal of the canidae family

lines.value: the word coyote comes from the nahuatl aztec word coyotl

lines.value: the color of the coyote's fur is a grayish brown to yellowish gray on the upper parts while the throat and underside are a more white color
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the forelegs sides of the head muzzle and feet are reddish brown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coyotes live only in north america and some areas of central america

lines.value: they live in the countryside but also in cities too
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the coyote is found throughout north america from california up to as far as alaska
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they normally live in dens about 6 feet wide and four feet tall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the coyote is an omnivore and can eat many kinds of food fruits grasses and vegetables in the autumn and winter months along with small animals for example rabbits mice shrews voles and foxes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also eat birds deer snakes and lizards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the city coyotes find food easily
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they dig up plants in gardens and eat food out of garbage cans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes they join small packs groups but normally hunt alone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coyotes live in dens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they dig a tunnel under the ground and then dig out a larger area at the end of the tunnel where they sleep and have their babies or pups
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they can have six pups at a time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often a coyote den will have two entrances with one that is hidden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes they dig more than one den so they can move if an enemy finds the den
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: coyotes do not have many enemies

lines.value: wolves used to eat coyotes but there are not many wolves left in north america compared to the number of coyotes

lines.value: the geneva conventions are a set of four treaties of international law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all of the four treaties are about humanitarian issues

lines.value: the swiss henri dunant was the person who started the creation of the conventions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he did this after he saw the unimaginable ty of the battle of solferino in 1859

lines.value: some parts of the four geneva conventions say that all countries who signed must create national laws to make of the geneva conventions a crime
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the conventions and their agreements are as follows

lines.value: in addition there are three more to the geneva conventions

lines.value: mitosis is part of the cycle of cell division
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chromosomes of a cell are copied to make two identical sets of chromosomes and the cell nucleus divides into two identical nuclei
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before mitosis the cell creates an identical set of its own genetic information - this is called replication
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the genetic information is in the dna of the chromosomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the beginning of mitosis the chromosomes wind up into visible objects that can be seen with a light microscope
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chromosomes are now two chromatids joined at the centromere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since the two chromatids are identical to each other they are called sister chromatids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mitosis happens in all types of dividing cells in the human body except with sperm and ova
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sperm and ova are gametes or sex cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the gametes are produced by a different division method called meiosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are five phases of mitosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each phase is used to describe what kind of change the cell is going through
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the phases are prophase prometaphase metaphase anaphase and telophase
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during prophase chromosomes in the nucleus condense
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pairs of centrioles move to opposite sides of the nucleus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spindle fibers begin to form a bridge between the ends of the cell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during prometaphase the nuclear envelope around the chromosomes breaks down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now there is no nucleus and the sister chromatids are free
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a protein called a kinetochore forms at each centromere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: long thin proteins reach across from opposite poles of the cell and attach to each kinetochore
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during metaphase the sister chromatids are aligned by the pushing and pulling of the attached kinetochore microtubules similar to a game of tug of war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both sister chromatids stay attached to each other at the centromere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the chromosomes line up on the cell's equator or center line and are prepared for division
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during anaphase the sister chromatids split apart and move from the cell's equator metaphase plate to the poles of the cell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kinetochore is attached to the centromere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the microtubules hold on to kinetochore and shorten in length
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another group of microtubules the non kinetochore microtubules do the opposite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they become longer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cell begins to stretch out as the opposite ends are pushed apart
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: telophase is the final stage in mitosis the cell itself is ready to divide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one set of chromosomes is now at each pole of the cell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each set is identical
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the spindle fibers begin to disappear and a nuclear membrane forms around each set of chromosomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also a nucleolus appears within each new nucleus and single stranded chromosomes uncoil into invisible strands of chromatin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cytokinesis even though it is very important to cell division is not considered a stage of mitosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during cytokinesis the cell physically splits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this occurs just after anaphase and during telophase
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cleavage furrow which is the pinch caused by the ring of proteins pinches off completely closing off the cell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cell now has reproduced itself successfully
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after cytokinesis the cell goes back into interphase where the cycle is repeated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if cytokinesis were to occur to a cell that had not gone through mitosis then the daughter cells would be different or not function properly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one would still have the nucleus and the other would lack a nucleus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cytokinesis is different in both animals and plant cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in plant cells instead of splitting into two halves it forms a cell plate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mount fuji 富士山 fuji san is the tallest mountain in japan at high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also a volcano
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is on the border between shizuoka prefecture and yamanashi prefecture
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mount fuji is a famous cultural icon of japan as a lot of people have painted it and taken photographs of it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it became the 13th unesco world heritage site in japan on june 22 2013
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last time it erupted was 1707 to 1906
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mount fuji is officially classified as an active volcano but some describe fuji as dormant or inactive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the last major event was the hoei eruption of mount fuji which started on december 16 1707 hoei 4 23rd day of the 11th month and ended about january 1 1708 hoei 4 9th day of the 12th month during the edo period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cinders and ash from fuji fell like rain in izu province kai province sagami province and musashi province
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mountain is thought to be named after fuchi the buddhist fire goddess
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mountain is sacred in the shinto religion and at the bottom of the mountain are shrines to the goddess konohananosakuya hime コノハナノサクヤヒメ）
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people climb mt fuji every year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the official climbing season is in the summer july 25 to august 25
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are three mountain climbing routes on the shizuoka side of mt fuji
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a post office on the top of mt fuji which is open only in summer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the post office was built in 1909 and is the highest post office in japan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2009 mount fuji was as one of the 100 landscapes of japan which best show japan and its culture in the heisei period

lines.value: athelstan or athelstan 893/4-27 october 939 called the glorious was the first king of england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he reigned from 924 to 939
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was the son of king edward the elder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athelstan's reign is sometimes overlooked but it was of great importance to political developments in the 10th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athelstan was the son of edward the elder and grandson of alfred the great
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father succeeded after some difficulty to the kingdom of the anglo saxons formed by alfred
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father had also been the king of mercia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when edward died athelstan quickly became king of mercia but he was not immediately accepted as king of england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his brother alfweard had more support in england but died soon after edward
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this made it easier for athelstan to become king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for athelstan it was very important to have many allies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a year after his crowning he married one of his sisters to the viking king of northumbria sithric
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however sithric died only a year later and athelstan seized northumbria
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this move made him king of more land than any other before him roughly the same as modern england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: historical records indicate that the other rulers in great britain accepted him as king at bamburgh around this time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: athelstan died at gloucester in 939 and was succeeded by his half brother edmund i
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sebaceous glands are microscopic tiny glands in the skin which produce an oily waxy substance called sebum to lubricate oil the skin and hair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in people these glands are found in greatest amounts on the face and scalp joined near the top inside hair follicles or sweat pores
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however they are in all skin areas except the palms and soles of the feet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are different kinds of these glands and sebum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the eyelids meibomian sebaceous glands emit a special kind of sebum into tears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are several related medical conditions including acne sebaceous cysts hyperplasia sebaceous adenoma and sebaceous gland carcinoma see section below diseases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: washing skin or hair with plain detergent can cut the amount of sebum in oily skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also water temperature over can keep sebum molten during a wash
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a branched kind of acinar gland the sebaceous glands are found in people all over the skin except in the palms of the hands and soles of the feet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebaceous glands are often found in hair covered areas where they are connected near the top of hair follicles see image at top
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the glands deposit sebum on each hair and bring it to the skin surface along the hair shaft
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the structure consisting of hair hair follicle arrector pili muscle and sebaceous gland is known as a pilosebaceous unit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebaceous glands are also found in non haired areas glabrous skin of the eyelids nose penis labia minora and nipples
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here the sebum travels along ducts which end inside sweat pores near the surface of the skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the rim of the eyelids meibomian glands are a specialized form of sebaceous gland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they secrete a form of sebum known as meibum onto the eye which slows the drying of tears
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebaceous glands produce the oily waxy substance called sebum latin meaning fat or tallow that is made of fat lipids wax and the leftover dead fat producing cells
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the glands sebum is produced within specialized cells and is released as these cells burst sebaceous glands are thus classified as holocrine glands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebum has no smell but its bacterial breakdown can produce a bad smell
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebum is the cause of some people experiencing oily hair as in hot weather or if not washed for several days
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: earwax is partly composed of sebum
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebum can be washed using plain detergent to dissolve the waxy material in the skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also water for washing should be over to keep the sebum molten
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: excess sebum has been linked to eating red meats fried and oily foods and some other type of foods but different research shows multiple theories about it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is commonly believed that sebum acts to save skin from drying or to waterproof hair and skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but some scientists have contended that low levels of sebaceous gland activity are not correlated with dry skin and it may serve little or no purpose in modern humans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the substances in sebum vary between species
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in people the lipid content is as follows also sapienic acid is a sebum fatty acid that is found only in people not in animals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the following medicines have been shown to reduce the flow of sebum from skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sebaceous glands of a human fetus in utero secrete a substance called vernix caseosa a waxy or cheesy white substance covering the skin of newborn babies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the activity of the sebaceous glands increases during puberty because of heightened levels of androgens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in males sebaceous glands begin to appear predominantly on the penis on the shaft and around the rim of the penile head during and after puberty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is however normal not to be confused with an std
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in females they appear predominantly in the labia minora
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebaceous glands are involved in skin problems such as oily skin acne and keratosis pilaris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the skin pores sebum and keratin can create a hyperkeratotic plug called a microcomedo which can block a pore and cause pimples
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the prescription medicine isotretinoin significantly reduces the amount of sebum produced by the sebaceous glands and is used to treat acne
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the extreme use up to 10 times doctor prescribed amounts of anabolic steroids by bodybuilders for muscle gain can also cause acne
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the sebaceous gland is stimulated due to some steroid conversion into dihydrotestosterone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this event may cause serious acne on the face neck chest back and shoulders
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a blocked sebaceous gland can result in a sebaceous cyst
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a condition involving enlarged sebaceous glands is known as sebaceous hyperplasia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebaceous gland carcinoma is a very uncommon and aggressive form of cancer involving the sebaceous glands sebaceous adenoma is a more benign neoplasm of the sebaceous glands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sebum can also build up around body piercings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: certain species of demodex mites feed on sebum and are commonly found in the sebaceous glands of mammals including those of humans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the preputial glands of mice and rats are large modified sebaceous glands that produce pheromones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the great chilean earthquake or valdivian earthquake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded

lines.value: the quake occurred in the early afternoon 19:11 utc of may 22 1960 and had a 9.5 rating on the moment magnitude scale
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earthquake affected southern chile hawaii japan the philippines and the aleutian islands in alaska
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its epicenter was valdivia chile
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the earthquake caused tsunamis that pounded the chilean coastline with waves of up to 25 meters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the main tsunami traveled across the pacific ocean and caused great damage to hilo hawaii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: waves as high as 10.7 meters about 35 feet were recorded 10000 kilometers from where the earthquake started
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these waves travelled as far as japan and the philippines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the total number of deaths from the earthquake and subsequent tsunami was believed to be 6000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the damage was estimated at over half a billion dollars

lines.value: a cafe is a type of restaurant which usually serves coffee and snacks

lines.value: a sword is a hand held weapon made for cutting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is often made of metal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a long blade and a handle called a hilt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often there is some form of hand protection such as a cross guard or a basket
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be used either for cutting slashing or stabbing depending on the type of sword
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: swords were first created from bronze by blacksmiths in ancient egypt in 1150 bce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soon other cultures adopted them and they began to spread quite quickly
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before guns were invented swords were much more common as a weapon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the invention of the gun swords remained as sidearms as secondary weapons used in man to man fight once the battle lines had contacted after shooting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since after american civil war swords have not been used as much by armies except as a ceremonial part of uniforms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some guns however have bayonets to perform the same function
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today sport fencing is an olympic games sport which uses very light swords as a strict scoring system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: western martial arts use swords that are much closer to the original blades such as longswords rapiers and sabres
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the blades used are blunt but they are much heavier than a sport fencing sword which means the fencers need much more armour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: likewise the japanese sport kendo is swordplay in armour with two handed bamboo swords called shinai
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many kinds of swords

lines.value: one kind of sword is a sabre or saber

lines.value: a sabre is a curved light sword sharpened on one side and at the tip and was generally used on horseback

lines.value: a broadsword is a straight sword that is sharp on both sides and at the tip

lines.value: a rapier is long and thin with a basket protecting the hand

lines.value: another type of sword is a foil used in sport fencing and is long and thin with a button at the tip to protect the fencers from injury

lines.value: larger swords such as longswords or claymores are used with two hands

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some katanas are used with one hand while other larger versions are used with two hands

lines.value: the korean language korean is spoken mainly in north and south korea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is spoken by more than 78 million people most of whom are north or south koreans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in south korea it is called hangukmal 한국말 or hangugeo hangeul 한국어 hanja 韓國語
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in north korea however it is called choseonmal 조선말 or choseoneo 조선어 朝鮮語
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are named differently because the common names for north and south korea are different
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in additional koreans usually call their language urimal hangeul 우리말 or urinara mal hangeul 우리나라 말 meaning our language or our country's language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the korean language uses two different writing systems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first is hangul the main alphabet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in north korea only hangeul known as choseongeul in north korea is used by law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in south korea only hangeul should be used in most public areas like education but the second system hanja is still used in some newspapers and professional areas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hanja is the system of chinese characters that are used in korean
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hanja was the only way to write korean before the creation of hangeul in the 15th century and it was common in novels before the 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite the fact that king sejong the great led the development of hangeul in order to allow literacy to spread among common people and to create a writing system that more accurately represented the korean language than hanja it was not adopted by the upper classes of koreans and therefore hanja would continue to be the official writing system util the late 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: despite it being rejected by the elite classes hangeul was used often by lower classes as a way to write down korean literature and for lower classes to communicate with each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a nerve is a group of special nerve cells grouped together in parallel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another word for nerve cell is neuron
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the special neurons grouped together in nerves take information messages to and from the human body to the central nervous system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the central nervous system acronym cns is the brain and spinal cord
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the spinal cord is the big cord that goes from the brain into the back
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it carries all the information that goes from the brain to the nerves in the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all the nerves in the body make the peripheral nervous system acronym pns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the brain and spinal cord are the cns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all the nerves that come from the spinal cord are the pns
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: together the cns and pns are the nervous system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nervous system contains neurons and cells called glia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: glia cells keep the neurons safe and healthy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: neurons take messages to and from the cns to the rest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the dendrite and axon are fibers that go out from the cell body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: axons take information away from the cell body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dendrites take information to the cell body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: afferent nerves take messages to the cns brain from the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they take messages about sensation from the skin
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they take messages about the position of the body from the muscles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they take messages about the function of organs like the heart and stomach
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: efferent nerves take messages from the cns to the body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they take messages that tell muscles to move
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they take messages to glands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they tell glands like sweat glands to make sweat the water that comes out of your skin when you are hot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many diseases of nerves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a disease of nerves is also called a neuropathy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris is a dwarf planet and a trans neptunian object tno
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris is the second largest known dwarf planet in the solar system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a scattered disc object and it is in the kuiper belt farther out than pluto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is also called a plutoid because the iau decided to rename all trans neptunian dwarf planets as plutoids
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris orbits the sun once every 557 earth years and it has an elliptical orbit inclined at an angle of 44° between the plane of the orbit of the planet and the ecliptic which is the plane containing earth's orbital path
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris has one moon called dysnomia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris was discovered by michael e brown chad trujillo and david rabinowitz on january 5 2005 when they were having a close look at some images of the outer solar system taken in 2003
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris was originally called xena after the main character of the television series
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however there is a rule stating that all objects orbiting outside neptune's orbit have to be named after a creation of mythology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therefore it was officially named eris on september 13 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris is named after the goddess of strife discord contention and rivalry in greek mythology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: eris has one moon called dysnomia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was discovered on september 10 2005
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dysnomia was originally nicknamed gabrielle after a character from the television series xena warrior princess like eris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however like eris it could not be called this
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dysnomia was named after the daughter of eris in greek mythology
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dysnomia is the goddess or spirit of lawlessness and poor civil constitution
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: media reports have argued that eris is the tenth planet along with astronomers and nasa scientists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the definition of a planet was changed in august 2006
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: under the new specifications eris along with pluto was lowered in status to a dwarf planet
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: scientists are continuing to find out more about eris and its moon and to look for any more moons and possible rings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because eris is so far away it would take 24.5 years to visit eris with a space probe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the industrial revolution is the name historians have given to the period in history when there was a large and rapid change in the way things were made
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this meant that instead of things being hand made in small workshops they were made in large quantities by machines in factories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: products being made in large quantity now meant that they were sold for less
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people began to move from an agricultural based life in the country to the towns where the factories offered more and better paid work
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the industrial revolution began in great britain in the middle of the 18th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in particular the county of shropshire was important for it had both minerals e.g iron ore and coal and transport on the river severn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this led to the group of industries near the ironbridge gorge and the town of coalbrookdale
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the revolution spread to europe and the americas especially the united states by the early 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: samuel slater who had been an apprentice in an english cotton factory disguised himself and came to america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he reconstructed a spinning machine from memory and built a factory of his own
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: new ideas and inventions were also taken up and used in mining the working of metals and in the transport of goods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around the same time new ideas in farming were leaving some farm workers without jobs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they added to the move to the industrial towns where they sought out work in factories
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most important new invention of the industrial revolution was the steam engine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the steam engine improved by james watt around 1776 was used to power the factories and pump out mines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was also used in locomotives and steamboats
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the heat from burning coal became the main source of power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: historians still disagree on why the industrial revolution happened when it did and why it happened in england first
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it built on a new spirit of studying things through science
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 17th century began a period now called the enlightenment during which people asked more questions about the way the world worked
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: england also was a politically stable country throughout the 18th century with no wars at home although it had many abroad
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: england also had many of the raw materials needed to make and power the new machines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it also had an overseas empire that would buy the goods it made and provide it with a cheap source of other raw materials such as cotton and sugar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the time of the industrial revolution the slave trade was abolished but slavery was still practiced in many british empire lands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this supplied a source for some of the money which could be spent on building the new industries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also england had much less land that could be farmed compared to other european countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: living standards rose and people generally became richer and healthier and had more children who survived to be adults instead of starving
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the resulting population growth in england caused new problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the environment was damaged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: where only a few people had been rich because they owned land now more became very rich thanks to industry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as before however most people were poor and lived in poor conditions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: children and women had to work for a long time for little pay
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often several families crowded into very small apartments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: working at different times family members would take turns sleeping when they were not working
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: families were usually unable to get together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 12 14 or even 18-hour workdays were common
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the industrial revolution brought problems of its own
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the industrial revolution new technology brought many changes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caribbean or caribbean area dutch cariben or caraiben french caraibe or more commonly antilles spanish caribe is a region of the americas

lines.value: it includes the caribbean sea its islands more than 7000 islands small islands and cays most of them surrounding the sea and the coasts of north south america and east central america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caribbean is bordered by the atlantic ocean to its east and north the coast of south america to its south the coast of central america to its southwest and by the gulf of mexico to its northwest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the west indies is the name for the group of the islands of the bahamas and the antilles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the antilles are divided into two groups the larger greater antilles on the north limit of the caribbean sea and the lesser antilles on the east and south
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the caribbean islands have many different types of land
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of this the islands have many different kinds of plants and animals even uncommon ones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: famous islands in the caribbean include cuba jamaica puerto rico and hispaniola
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the countries of dominican republic and haiti are on hispaniola
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is also a lot of white sandy beaches and hot sun there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name caribbean comes from carib indigenous people living in the lesser antilles and north south america when the europeans came to the americas

lines.value: the 18th century saw many countries trying to colonize the islands

lines.value: because of this caribbean culture is very similar to those of africa india and many countries in europe

lines.value: the american revolutionary war was a war fought between great britain and the original 13 british colonies in north america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the war took place from 1775 to 1783 with fighting in north america and other places
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the continental army army of the colonies led by george washington and helped by france and other powers defeated the armies of the british empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after the war ended the thirteen colonies became independent which meant that the british empire was no longer in charge of them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they together became the first 13 states of a new country called the united states of america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the war started after years of problems between the british empire and the colonists of north america after the french and indian war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people in the thirteen colonies disliked many of the actions of the british government such as the intolerable acts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for many years the british government decided which countries could trade with the colonies instead of the colonies deciding it themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many colonists wanted free trade
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1765 the british parliament needed money to pay back the debt for the french and indian war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they passed a law called the stamp act
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this law said that colonists had to buy stamps for legal papers newspapers and even playing cards as other british people did
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the money from the stamps went to the king
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the colonies did not follow this law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the colonies kept refusing to do what the king wanted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the boston tea party and boston massacre caused people to become more angry about the situation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the british sent more soldiers red coats to keep control of the colonies and they sometimes had to fight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1774 the british passed the intolerable acts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not all colonists wanted to leave the british empire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the loyalists or tories stayed loyal to great britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were not going to change their views
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the patriots or whigs wanted independence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before the revolutionary war most people in america were loyalists but after it most people were patriots
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many colonists wrote letters showing how they felt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thomas paine wrote common sense a famous pamphlet about independence from britain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other colonial leaders such as benjamin franklin john adams and thomas jefferson wanted independence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first battles of the american revolutionary war were lexington and concord
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the first major battles was the battle of bunker hill in 1775
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after that the british controlled boston
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around that time the second continental congress sent an olive branch petition to king george iii which he rejected and named george washington head of the army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: early in 1776 washington's army drove the british out of boston
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few months later the continental army and british troops under william howe fought the new york and new jersey campaign
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during the new york battles the british started using hessian troops who were from germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: though the colonists lost new york the british would hold it for the rest of the war washington was able to hold onto most of his army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over christmas 1776-77 washington crossed the delaware river and defeated the hessians at trenton and the british at princeton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1777 the british attacked the city of philadelphia then the american capital
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: two battles were fought over philadelphia brandywine and germantown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: again the americans lost a major city but washington was able to keep most of his army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: around this time the frenchman lafayette joined the american army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1778 the british left philadelphia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: between 1778 and 1781 most battles between washington and the british were inconclusive they did not have any major effect militarily
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the most important battles was the battle of saratoga in 1777
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: american soldiers under horatio gates forced a british surrender under john burgoyne
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this led to france and spain joining the war on the side of americans
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these powerful countries fought the british around the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: from 1778 to 1780 there was fighting in the west
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the american commerce raider john paul jones also won several naval battles over the british but the french navy did most of the fighting at sea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the americans tried to capture canada several times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1779 major fighting shifted to georgia and south carolina
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as fighting spread northward general nathanael greene led the rebel campaign
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he caused many people in the south to be patriots instead of loyalists and won several battles against the british
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1781 washington and french general jean rochambeau led an offensive against british troops in yorktown virginia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was called the battle of yorktown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when their soldiers lost this battle the british surrendered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the british continued to fight the french and spanish for two years winning in india gibraltar and elsewhere
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the american revolutionary war came to an end in 1783 when a peace treaty was signed in paris france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the treaty of paris the british king george iii accepted the independence of the colonies and recognized the newly created nation as the united states of america
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the treaty also gave all the land britain said it owned which was west of the appalachians as far as the mississippi river to the new country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this land would eventually become part of the us and lead to the creation of 35 new states some of which later rebelled as part of the confederate states of america that now make up the contiguous united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many loyalists fled to canada
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: youngstown is a city in ohio united states
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the county seat of mahoning county
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: part of youngstown is also in trumbull county
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the town is on the mahoning river
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is about southeast of cleveland and northwest of pittsburgh pennsylvania
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: youngstown has its own metropolitan area it is often thought of as part of the pittsburgh tri state area and greater cleveland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: youngstown is west of the pennsylvania state line
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is midway between new york city and chicago via interstate 80
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city was named for john young
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was an early settler from whitestown new york who started the town's first sawmill and gristmill
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: youngstown is in an area of the united states that is often called the rust belt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the town was known as a center of steel making
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: youngstown was forced to change itself when the us steel industry fell into decline in the 1970s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: towns in the area did not have a lot of business after that
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: youngstown also falls within the appalachian ohio region among the foothills of the appalachian mountains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2010 census showed that youngstown had a total population of 66982 making it ohio's ninth largest city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atheism is rejecting the belief in a god or gods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the opposite of theism which is the belief that at least one god exists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a person who s belief in gods is called an atheist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atheism is not the same as agnosticism agnostics say that there is no way to know whether gods exist or not

lines.value: being an agnostic does not have to mean a person rejects or believes in god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some agnostics are theists believing in god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the theologian kierkegaard is an example
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other agnostics are atheists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atheists often give reasons why they do not believe in a god or gods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three of the reasons that they often give are the problem of evil the argument from inconsistent revelations and the argument from nonbelief
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not all atheists think these reasons provide complete proof that gods cannot exist but these are the reasons given to support rejecting belief that gods exist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some atheists do not believe in any god because they feel that there is no evidence for any god nor gods and goddesses so believing any type of theism means believing unproved
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these atheists think a simpler explanation for everything is methodological naturalism which means that only natural things exist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: occam's razor shows simple explanations without many unproved guesses are more likely to be true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word atheism comes from the greek language
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be divided into a ἄ a greek prefix meaning without and theos oeos meaning god and recombined to form without gods or godless
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in ancient greece it also meant impious
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: starting in about the 5th century bc the word came to describe people who were severing relations with the gods or denying the gods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: before then the meaning had been closer to impious
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is also the abstract noun (), atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cicero transliterated the greek word into the latin atheos
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this word was often used in the debate between early christians and hellenists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each side used it to label the other in a bad way.<ref name=drachmann> karen armstrong writes that during the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries the word atheist was still reserved exclusively for the term atheist was an insult
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nobody would have dreamed of calling himself an atheist atheism was first used to describe an openly positive belief in late 18th-century europe meaning disbelief in the monotheistic abrahamic god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 20th century saw the term expand to refer to disbelief in all deities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however it is still common in western society to describe atheism as simply disbelief in god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many places it is or was a crime to make public the idea of atheism

lines.value: examples would be to claim the bible or qur'an could not be true or to speak or write that there is no god

lines.value: muslim apostasy that is becoming an atheist or believing in a god other than allah may be a dangerous act in places with many conservative muslim people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many religious courts have punished and some still punish this act with the death penalty

lines.value: many countries still have laws against atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atheism is becoming more common mainly in south america north america oceania and europe by percentage of people that had a religion before and started to be atheist

lines.value: in many countries mainly in the western world there are laws that protect atheists right to express their atheistic belief freedom of speech

lines.value: this means that atheists have the same rights under the law as everyone else

lines.value: freedom of religion in international law and treaties includes the freedom to not have a religion

lines.value: people disagree about what atheism means

lines.value: they disagree on when to call certain people atheists or not
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atheism is generally described as not believing in god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: george h smith created the expressions implicit atheism and explicit atheism to describe the difference between different types of atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: implicit atheism is when you do not believe in god because you do not know about the concept of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: explicit atheism is when you do not believe in god after learning about the idea
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1772 baron d'holbach said that all children are born atheists they have no idea of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1979 george h smith said that the man who is unacquainted with theism is an atheist because he does not believe in a god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this category would also include the child [who is able to] grasp the issues involved but who is still unaware of those issues
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the fact that this child does not believe in god qualifies him as an atheist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: those two quotes describe implicit atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ernest nagel disagrees with smith's definition of atheism as an absence of theism saying only explicit atheism is true atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reprinted in critiques of god edited by peter a angeles prometheus books 1997
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that nagel believes that to be an atheist a person needs to know about god and then the idea of god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: philosophers like antony flew have looked at strong sometimes called positive atheism against weak sometimes called negative atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: according to this idea anyone who does not believe in a god or gods is either a weak or a strong atheist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: strong atheism is the certain belief that no god exists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an older way of saying strong atheism is to say positive atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: weak atheism is all other forms of not believing in a god or gods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an older way of saying weak atheism is to say negative atheism these have been used more in philosophical writing and in catholic beliefs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since at least 1813
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: under this definition of atheism most agnostics are weak atheists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: michael martin says that agnosticism includes weak atheism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some agnostics including anthony kenny disagree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they think being an agnostic is different from being an atheist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they think atheism is no different from believing in a god because both require belief
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this overlooks the reality that agnostics also have their own belief or claim to knowledge agnostics say that it cannot be known if a god or gods exist
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in their view strong atheism requires a leap of faith
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: atheists usually respond by saying that there is no difference between an idea about religion with no proof and an idea about other things the lack of proof that god does not exist does not mean that there is no god but it also does not mean that there is a god
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: scottish philosopher jjc smart says that sometimes a person who is really an atheist may describe herself even passionately as an agnostic because of unreasonable generalised philosophical skepticism which would preclude us from saying that we know anything whatever except perhaps the truths of mathematics and formal logic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so some popular atheist authors such as richard dawkins like to show the difference between theist agnostic and atheist positions by the assigned to the statement god exists
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in everyday life many people define natural phenomena without the need of a god or gods
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they do not deny the existence of one or more gods they simply say that this existence is not necessary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mosovce is one of the biggest villages in the turiec region of slovakia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mosovce has existed for 770 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this time people built many old and beautiful buildings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: king andrew ii wrote about the village for the first time in 1233
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at first mosovce had two parts the first one machyuch was in the area of today's stary rad street
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the village took its today's name from the second part terra moys which was in the place of the present day vidrmoch street
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of the name of the second part which means the land of mojs we believe that all the village was the property of a certain mr mojs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his name could be a short form of a longer slavic name mojtech similar to the names vojtech or mojmir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the history the name of the village changed from mossovych mosocz mossowecz villa regia mayos alio nomine mossovych oppidioum mayus sue mosocz mosocz olim mayus to the present day mosovce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name of a separate very old part of mosovce chornukov chaged to the modern form of cernakov
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mosovce was at first a royal village and in about 1350 changed into a privileged town which belonged to the royal castle of blatnica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1527 the revay family became its owners and they took away the town privileges of mosovce for almost 400 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the past mosovce was an important craft center of the turiec region
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: crafts were very successful and there were around 15 guilds in the town the bootmaker and the most famous furrier guild existed for the longest time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the present day mosovce is an important tourist area with many interesting places
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the most interesting buildings is a small rococo classical palace with a big english park
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people built the palace in about 1750-1800
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other places in the town are the birthplace of jan kollar a neo gothic catholic church with a valuable altar built on the place of an older church a lutheran church built in 1784 a mausoleum an art nouveau greenhouse and a pavilion from 1800
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the mausoleum there is now a museum of crafts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the nature around mosovce is really beautiful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a system of old roads with trees and small forests create a nice landscape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this landscape looks nice with the forests of the velka fatra mountains
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this mountain range is one of the nicest ones in slovakia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people from all parts of the world come visit the beautiful limestone and dolomite rocks and the beautiful nature in the blatnicka and gaderska valleys which are not far away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many important people were born in mosovce
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the greatest ones are frico kafenda 1883-1963 composer anna lackova-zora 1899-1988 writer stefan krcmery 1892-1955 literary critic historian and poet jur tesak mosovsky baroque playwright and miloslav schmidt the founder of the fire brigades in slovakia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: probably the most important person born in mosovce is the great slavic poet philosopher and lutheran priest jan kollar 1793-1852 who was very active in the literature of at least two nations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wrote a book of poems called slavy dcera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his work was very important for the patriots and national activists who lived at the same time as kollar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people translated the book into many slavic and non slavic languages

lines.value: poole is a town in dorset england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the second biggest town in dorset after bournemouth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2001 138299 people lived there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lots of tourists visit poole because of its nice beaches and sunny weather
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a very big natural harbour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lots of people in poole work for barclays bank hamworthy engineering poole packaging sunseeker rnli and ryvita
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: poole's harbour is the second biggest natural harbour in the world after sydney in australia but the water in poole is very shallow which means that very big ships cannot go into poole harbour
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was used in world war ii for some ships to set off for france on d day

lines.value: the harbour entrance is also the home to many millionaires being in the top 5 most expensive places to live in the world

lines.value: people have lived in poole for 2000 years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there were lots of celtic people there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: archaeologists found a boat in the harbour which they think was made in 295 bc when the romans invaded britain in the 1st century they landed in poole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the norman conquest in 1066 poole was used mostly for fishing but then became a port for trading things like wool
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 18th century poole was one of the biggest ports in england
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the harbour stopped being so useful because big boats could not get in so they went to places like liverpool southampton and plymouth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: even though the harbour can not be used that well due to the shallowness of the sea it is very beautiful and peaceful for people

lines.value: in volcanology magma is melted rock that is under the ground
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma is the molten rocks in earth's mantle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma exists as pockets and plumes beneath the surface of the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma is a molten and semi molten rock mixture found under the surface of the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this mixture is usually made up of four parts a hot liquid base called the melt minerals crystallized by the melt solid rocks incorporated into the melt from the surrounding confines and dissolved gases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma is extremely hot between 700° and 1300° celsius 1292° and 2372° fahrenheit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this heat makes magma a fluid able to create new landforms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the heat also makes physical and chemical changes to old landform s there are many types of magma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one is called felsic magma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: felsic magma is thick high viscosity and has much of a mineral called silica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it mostly makes light coloured rocks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another type is called mafic magma which is runny and has less silica
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it usually makes dark coloured rocks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a third type is intermediate magma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is like both the other types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when magma becomes solid it's usually by cooling slowly far below the surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes plutonic rocks such as granite
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when magma comes out from the ground in a volcano and it is still melted it is called lava
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lava cools more quickly and forms other kinds of rock such as basalt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when magma is ejected by a volcano or other vent the material is called lava
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma that has cooled into a solid is called igneous rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hawaii molten magma hawaiian magma is different than magma in other parts of the earth because it has more molten rock and less dissolved gases
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this kind of magma makes fewer explosions than gassy magmas do
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hawaiian volcano kilauea on the big island of hawaii has erupted with enough molten lava to pave a road around the earth three times
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tapping into magma's potential in 2009 the icelandic deep drilling project created a well that uses magma to generate geothermal energy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: normally geothermal energy is created by pumping water into hot volcanic bedrock creating steam that then drives a turbine to generate electricity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while normal geothermal sources average around 60° to 80° celsius 140° to 176° fahrenheit the magma well's steam reached a recordbreaking temperature of 450° celsius 842° fahrenheit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this huge increase in temperature allowed just one magma well to generate roughly 36 megawatts of electricity powering 36000 homes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in comparison one single wind turbine generates between 1 to 3 megawatts and some steam power stations generate over a thousand megawatts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: how magma forms earth is divided into three general layers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the core is the superheated center the mantle is the thick middle layer and the crust is the top layer on which we live
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma originates in the lower part of the earth's crust and in the upper portion of the mantle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the mantle and crust are solid so the presence of magma is crucial to understanding the geology and morphology of the mantle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: differences in temperature pressure and structural formations in the mantle and crust cause magma to form in different ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: decompression melting decompression melting involves the upward movement of earth's mostly solid mantle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this hot material rises to an area of lower pressure through the process of convection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: areas of lower pressure always have a lower melting point than areas of high pressure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this reduction in overlying pressure or decompression enables the mantle rock to melt and form magma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: decompression melting often occurs at divergent boundaries where tectonic plates separate
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rifting movement causes the buoyant magma below to rise and fill the space of lower pressure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rock then cools into new crust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: decompression melting also occurs at mantle plumes columns of hot rock that rise from earth's high pressure core to its lower pressure crust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when located beneath the ocean these plumes also known as hot spots push magma onto the seafloor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these volcanic mounds can grow into volcanic islands over millions of years of activity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transfer of heat magma can also be created when hot liquid rock intrudes into earth's cold crust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the liquid rock solidifies it loses its heat to the surrounding crust
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: much like hot fudge being poured over cold ice cream this transfer of heat is able to melt the surrounding rock the ice cream into magma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transfer of heat often happens at convergent boundaries where tectonic plates are crashing together
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the denser tectonic plate subducts or sinks below or the less dense tectonic plate hot rock from below can intrude into the cooler plate above
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this process transfers heat and creates magma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over millions of years the magma in this subduction zone can create a series of active volcanoes known as a volcanic arc flux melting flux melting occurs when water or carbon dioxide are added to rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these compounds cause the rock to melt at lower temperatures
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this creates magma in places where it originally maintained a solid structure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: much like heat transfer flux melting also occurs around subduction zones
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this case water overlying the subducting seafloor would lower the melting temperature of the mantle generating magma that rises to the surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma escape routes magma leaves the confines of the upper mantle and crust in two major ways as an intrusion or as an extrusion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an intrusion can form features such as dikes and xenoliths
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an extrusion could include lava and volcanic rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma can intrude into a low density area of another geologic formation such as a sedimentary rock structure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it cools to solid rock this intrusion is often called a pluton
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a pluton is an intrusion of magma that wells up from below the surface
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plutons can include dikes and xenoliths
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a magmatic dike is simply a large slab of magmatic material that has intruded into another rock body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a xenolith is a piece of rock trapped in another type of rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many xenoliths are crystals torn from inside the earth and embedded in magma while the magma was cooling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most familiar way for magma to escape or extrude to earth's surface is through lava
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lava eruptions can be fire fountains of liquid rock or thick slow moving rivers of molten material
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lava cools to form volcanic rock as well as volcanic glass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma can also extrude into earth's atmosphere as part of a violent volcanic explosion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this magma solidifies in the air to form volcanic rock called tephra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the atmosphere tephra is more often called volcanic ash
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as it falls to earth tephra includes rocks such as pumice
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: magma chamber in areas where temperature pressure and structural formation allow magma can collect in magma chambers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most magma chambers sit far beneath the surface of the earth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pool of magma in a magma chamber is layered
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the least dense magma rises to the top
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the densest magma sinks near the bottom of the chamber
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over millions of years many magma chambers simply cool to form a pluton or large igneous intrusion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a magma chamber encounters an enormous amount of pressure however it may fracture the rock around it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the cracks called fissures or vents are tell tale signs of a volcano
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many volcanoes sit over magma chambers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a volcano's magma chamber experiences greater pressure often due to more magma seeping into the chamber the volcano may undergo an eruption
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an eruption reduces the pressure inside the magma chamber
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as long as more magma pools into a volcano's magma chamber there is the possibility of an eruption and the volcano will remain active
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: large eruptions can nearly empty the magma chamber
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the layers of magma may be documented by the type of eruption material the volcano emits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: gases ash and light colored rock are emitted first from the least dense top layer of the magma chamber
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dark dense volcanic rock from the lower part of the magma chamber may be released later
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in violent eruptions the volume of magma shrinks so much that the entire magma chamber collapses and forms a caldera
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: types of magma all magma contains gases and a mixture of simple elements
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: being that oxygen and silicon are the most abundant elements in magma geologists define magma types in terms of their silica content expressed as sio2
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these differences in chemical composition are directly related to differences in gas content temperature and viscosity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mafic magma mafic magma has relatively low silica content roughly 50% and higher contents in iron and magnesium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this type of magma has a low gas content and low viscosity or resistance to flow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mafic magma also has high mean temperatures between 1000o and 2000o celsius 1832o and 3632o fahrenheit which contributes to its lower viscosity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: low viscosity means that mafic magma is the most fluid of magma types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it erupts non explosively and moves very quickly when it reaches earth's surface as lava
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this lava cools into basalt a rock that is heavy and dark in color due to its higher iron and magnesium levels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: basalt is one of the most common rocks in earth's crust as well as the volcanic islands created by hot spots
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hawaiian islands are a direct result of mafic magma eruptions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: steady and relatively calm lava fountains continue to change and expand the big island of hawaii
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: intermediate magma intermediate magma has higher silica content roughly 60% than mafic magma
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this results in a higher gas content and viscosity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its mean temperature ranges from 800o to 1000o celsius 1472o to 1832o fahrenheit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result of its higher viscosity and gas content intermediate magma builds up pressure below the earth's surface before it can be released as lava
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this more gaseous and sticky lava tends to explode violently and cools as andesite rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: intermediate magma most commonly transforms into andesite due to the transfer of heat at convergent plate boundaries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: andesitic rocks are often found at continental volcanic arcs such as the andes mountains in south america after which they are named
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: felsic magma felsic magma has the highest silica content of all magma types between 65-70%
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a result felsic magma also has the highest gas content and viscosity and lowest mean temperatures between 650o and 800o celsius 1202o and 1472o fahrenheit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thick viscous felsic magma can trap gas bubbles in a volcano's magma chamber
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these trapped bubbles can cause explosive and destructive eruptions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these eruptions eject lava violently into the air which cools into dacite and rhyolite rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: much like intermediate magma felsic magma may be most commonly found at convergent plate boundaries where transfer of heat and flux melting create large stratovolcanoes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: grave was the word that was used to describe mass before the word kilogram was introduced
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: grave comes from the word gravity and was first used in 1793 in france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the name kilogram was introduced in 1795 but was not the official word for mass until 1875
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in order to have full consistency in the international system of units si many people think that the kilogram should be called something different
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: using the word kilogram creates a problem because it is a base unit that has the prefix kilo already in its name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to fix the problem some people have suggested using the word grave again
lines.name: Simple English
